entry.title: Split cryptohome recovery screen
entry.content:
This CL leaves CryptohomeRecovery screen with only responsibility

to authenticate using Recovery key (and rotate it afterwards).



The factor reset would be performed by ApplyOnlinePassword/

LocalPasswordSetup screens, errors are reported under

OSAuthErrorScreen, and success message is handled by

FactorSetupSuccess screen.



All changes above are guraded under

CryptohomeRecoveryBeforeFlowSplit flag.

entry.title: [Blink] Refine ImageToBufferCopier SharedImage GLES2 usage
entry.content:
ImageToBufferCopier creates a destination SharedImage whose purpose is

to receive the contents of a source `Image` via GL, followed by vending

out its backing native buffer handle to be read by the display

compositor. Hence, this SharedImage does not need

SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_GLES2_READ but only SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_GLES2_WRITE.



Bug: 1512542

entry.title: [iOS] Do not offer recent tab promo when history is disabled by admin
entry.content:
The synchronization of tabs and of history are getting merged

together.

While currently administrators can disable a single one of them,

the UI is not fully able to offer to use a single one of them. There

is no promo that offer to sign-in for one and not the other.



This CL ensures that, in this case, the promo is not shown at all.



This also fixes a related bug where the sync settings menu was opened

and could not close properly; given that, without promo, the sync

setting is not opened in the first place.



Fixed: 1511653

Fixed: 1511652

entry.title: Introduce regex result caching
entry.content:
This CL introduces an LRU cache for regex matching. This improves the

performance for form parsing by 16%. It provides more opportunities

because the new ParsingContext can cache the status of field trials on

hot codepaths which improves the performance further.



The new ParsingContext stores also parameters that need to be passed

around a lot like the page language, client country and pattern

source. In a followup CL, also the LogManager can be added to the

ParsingContext.



Bug: 1474308

entry.title: Refactor PermissionPromptBubbleBaseView
entry.content:
Do not override GetWindowTitle() and

GetAccessibleWindowTitle() as this duplicates logic already present in

WidgetDelegate.



Also, instead of having child classes pass this information in the

constructor let them use the existing setters instead.



Splitting the big do-it-all constructor into separate methods improves

readability and extensibility. You no longer have to add yet another

constructor parameter when something else in the base prompt needs to be

customized.

entry.title: [iOS] Make EG test wait for SU interstitial to appear
entry.content:
The test testSupervisedUserURLFilteringReloadsOnlyRealizedExistingWebStates

is flaky (see linked bug).



One reason that would explain the test failures in the bot, is that

after the browser restart (in the test) we check too early for the

existence of one interstitial, while we should wait for the page

to load (as the code that displays the interstitial is executed

asynchronously).



This change waits for a fixed timeout for the condition (existence

of interstitial) to become true.

entry.title: Rewrite and enable BrowserFocusTest.FocusTraversal
entry.content:
The test starts at the omnibox and presses tab (for forward traversal) or shift+tab (for backward traversal) keys until it reaches the omnibox again. Before this change, the test used a fixed number of key strokes and also checked if views or page elements were focused along the way which made the test a bit rigid. Besides, views in the focus chain differ between platforms causing extra complexity.



An attempt was made to use the Kombucha API but it wasn't successful. See patchset 4 for a Kombucha-fied version of the original test. I also tried writing a Kombucha version with non-fixed key strokes (not uploaded) but the API doesn't seem to be ready for that (yet).



Bug: 1259721

Change-Id: Iae31d6c7c02318aea65cc02a27144e4e68d02b6f

entry.title: [Blink] Convert DrawingBuffer to MappableSharedImage
entry.content:
This CL converts DrawingBuffer from using GpuMemoryBuffer to using

MappableSharedImage. The conversion is straightforward:



* Currently DrawingBuffer creates a GMB and then immediately creates

an SI from the GMB's handle.

* We instead create an SI via the CreateSI() path that causes a backing

GMBHandle to be created internally.

* Where the code previously checked for the GMB having been created, we

now track a bool explicitly for whether the MapppableSI was created.

* We remove ColorBuffer's keeping the GMB alive for its lifetime.

ColorBuffer already keeps the SI alive for its lifetime (it's put into

`back_buffer_mailbox`, which is passed to the created ColorBuffer and

on which that ColorBuffer calls DestroySI() at the same time as it

resets() the gmb)

* We remove the check for Platform having a GMBManager from

ShouldUseChromiumImage(). This check only served to ensure that the

code didn't try to create a GMB from a null GMBManager. MappableSI

doesn't use Platform's GMBManager to create GMBs internally. In the

current structure of the code any failure to create MappableSI will

flow down to the non-ShouldUseChromiumImage() case, as the code is

currently doing if there is no GMBManager.



Bug: 1431497

Change-Id: If15f199ee6d63176e70625c99b567c84fffcf125

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5119550

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Reviewed-by: Vasiliy Telezhnikov

Reviewed-by: Kentaro Hara

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1238562}

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Enable prioritizing navigation IPCs in field trial config""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 68ec9cefffd140919b52fc23c45094790190e2de.



Reason for revert: This fails the `TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest` tests on various builders, e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests/138916/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Reland "Enable prioritizing navigation IPCs in field trial config"

>

> This is a reland of commit 07d383329c6f004ed6b496567c05bd5b61142936

>

entry.title: [IdentifiabilityStudy] Always report new encountered surfaces
entry.content:
The IdentifiabilityStudy uses the EncounteredSurfaceTracker in order

to deduplicate outgoing metrics and avoid reporting the same surface

for the same source id again and again.



However, the code contained a bug, which made the

EncounteredSurfaceTracker eventually reject new surfaces based on an

arbitrary comparison between the hash of the new surface key and the

min of the hashes of 1000 previously encountered surface keys.



This CL fixes that bug, ensuring that new surfaces will always be

reported.



Change-Id: If512b38a995d6c4d1387541bdd6a3c27c66090d1

Cq-Do-Not-Cancel-Tryjobs: true

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5125952

Reviewed-by: Mike West

Commit-Queue: Antonio Sartori

entry.title: Split AddressAutofillTable from AutofillTable
entry.content:
See go/splitting-autofill-table. Creates a separate AddressAutofillTable

class by moving all address Autofill related code and tests to a

separate file. The code is moved into a new addresses/ subdirectory

1:1 without changes.

Like AutofillTable, it can be accessed through the a static

FromWebDatabase() getter. All callers are updated accordingly.



The ClearAllLocalData() and RemoveAutofillDataModifiedBetween()

functions that modify address and payments related tables are kept in

both classes and split accordingly. New calls in

AutofillWebDataBackendImpl are added.



AddressAutofillTable is a WebDatabaseTable, and as such instantiated

by WebDataServiceWrapper. Contrary to AutofillTable, which exists in

the profile and the account scoped database, AddressAutofillTable only

exists in the profile scoped database. This is because the account

scoped database is only used by Payments.



AutofillTable also implements syncer::SyncMetadataStore and acts as the

SyncMetadataStore for all components/autofill related sync logic. This

is kept as is. In the address Autofill related sync bridges,

AutofillTable is referenced for everything metadata related, and

AddressAutofillTable for everything non-metadata related.



As of this CL, only payments and sync metadata related code remains in

AutofillTable. A follow-up CL will move the sync metadata code into a

separate class, before finally renaming AutofillTable to

PaymentsAutofillTable.



Bug: 1508865

Change-Id: If5665059c901eb75c749bb06fd59be08ae28eec5

entry.title: [Autofill] Consider temp first/last name in CreditCard::GetRawInfo()
entry.content:
The canonical representation of the cardholder name in CreditCard is

name_on_card_. It can be set by calling SetRawInfo() for either

- CREDIT_CARD_NAME_FULL or

- CREDIT_CARD_NAME_FIRST and CREDIT_CARD_NAME_LAST.



Calling SetRawInfo() for CREDIT_CARD_NAME_{FIRST,LAST} sets

temp_card_{first,last}_name_ and merges them into name_on_card_ if both

are set.



This CL considers temp_card_{first,last}_name_ in GetRawInfo():



Suppose SetRawInfo() has been called for CREDIT_CARD_NAME_FIRST but not

yet for CREDIT_CARD_NAME_LAST. Now, calling GetRawInfo() for

- CREDIT_CARD_NAME_FIRST returns the temp_card_first_name_;

- CREDIT_CARD_NAME_LAST returns the name_on_card_'s last name.



This fixes corner cases for credit card import where the

CREDIT_CARD_NAME_{FIRST,LAST} fields have higher precedence

(e.g., because they're user-typed) than the

CREDIT_CARD_NAME_FULL field.



Bug: 1381477

Change-Id: Ie70736465b50ea502125c67778e4ae2b8fc36a97

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5020603

Reviewed-by: Dominic Battre

entry.title: Revert "[BreakIterator] Refactor by adding `Context`"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a8b10f34a154feb602d10097d2aca0b9d48af19c.



Reason for revert: This introduced errors on the Linux MSAN builder. E.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/WebKit%20Linux%20MSAN/24235/overview



Original change's description:

> [BreakIterator] Refactor by adding `Context`

>

> This patch refactors `LazyLineBreakIterator`, in particular,

> its hottest function `NextBreakablePosition` by introducing

> the `Context` struct.

>

> The `Context` struct caches 3 characters at the index, and is

> responsible for advancing the current index. This refactoring

> is a preparation for improving the performance of

> `PreviousBreakOpportunity`.

>

> Note, the current index isn't part of the struct, because

> doing so seems to have a negative impact.

>

> This patch has no behavior changes.

>

> Bug: 1512434

entry.title: [Shortstand] Add InstallShortcut interface for testing.
entry.content:
This CL adds a InstallShortcut interface in the web app test

util, and update one test suit to use it to verify. The purpose of

adding this interface is to:



1. When cros-shortstand flag turned on, the existing way of create

shortcut in test does not guarantee to meet the new criteria, adding

this general interface to use for all shortcut related tests



2. When cros-shortstand flag turned on, many existing tests that install

a web app in test does not guarantee to install a web app (it could

be shortcut, see https://crrev.com/c/5109197), so I'm planning to

update the InstallWebApp interface to ensure a web app (not shortcut)

is installed (something like https://crrev.com/c/5119467 with more

refactoring). To do that, we need to make sure all tests that needs a

shortcut have their own dedicate interface to use.



BUG=b/315263875

entry.title: [bfcache] Allow BFCache where there's ended MediaStreamTrack caused by getDisplayMedia()
entry.content:
This CL basically makes pages with no live Media Stream Track eligible for BFCache. When there's an "ended" (so-called "stopped", "closed") Media Stream Track caused by the use of the getDisplayMedia() method of MediaDevicesAPI, the page will be stored in BFCache. Note that the page will NOT be stored in BFCache when there's a "live" (so-called "active", "open") Media Stream Track.



The exception is that when there's an ended Media Stream Track caused by getUserMedia(), not getDisplayMedia(), the page will still be blocked from BFCaching for the reason kRequested(Audio/Video)CapturePermission.



The feature flag to guard this new implementation is defined in third_party/blink/common/features.cc because it needs to be used from both the blink and content components.



Also, this CL adds a new test to back_forward_cache_features_browsertests.cc, which checks that a page will be BFCached after a Media Stream Track is ended when getDisplayMedia() is used.



Bug: 1502395, 989379

Change-Id: I46bc6d960b3ffe6bbda1255e8d488143cb873413

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5075713

Reviewed-by: Kentaro Hara

Reviewed-by: Mingyu Lei

entry.title: WebNN: Set default axes for argMin/Max operation in mojo converter
entry.content:
This CL sets the default all axes for argMin/Max operation when the axes

parameter is not present in the mojo converter. This avoids a check

failure of `MLArgMinMaxOptions::axes()` [1] in the previous

implementation.

entry.title: FullscreenType: Migrate immersive and fullscreen on wayland
entry.content:
This CL lets platform window delegate be notified of immersive state and

fullscreen state change at once.



It also deprecates the pass not using TopLevelImmersiveStatus as

it's been supported since 2022.



It removes `browser_view_->browser()->FullscreenTopUIStateChanged()`

call in OnImmersiveModeChanged since its implementation is the same

as FullscreenStateChanged except for the bookmark bar state, but `BOOKMARK_BAR_STATE_CHANGE_TOOLBAR_OPTION_CHANGE` is not supported on

Lacros anyway, so we can remove it.



This is required to support LockedFullscreen testing.



This is part of fullscrene and immersive migration See

go/migrating-immersive-and-fullscreen for more details.

entry.title: [Autofill] Relax the requirements for credit card import
entry.content:
Before this CL, a necessary requirement for credit card import

was that there are no two fields of the same type with non-empty

value.



This CL weakens this requiments as follows.



Firstly, we drop the above requirement. Instead, we now check if

the values are equivalent. If not, we reject import.



Secondly, we now rank fields by priority: (1) user-edited fields,

(2) autofilled fields, (3) others. Fields of different priority

may have inconsistent values: the lower priority value is ignored.



For example, consider a form

Full name:

First name:

Last name:



Scenario 1: the user typed "Donald Trump", "Donald", and "Trump",

respectively. Then we offer import because the the values are

consistent.



Scenario 2: the user typed "Donald J. Trump" and autofilled "Donald"

and "Trump". Then we offer import for "Donald J. Trump" because

typing trumps autofilling.



Bug: 1381477

Change-Id: I79db1e2879049c219385b69ff981426d512c8e8e

entry.title: [MiracleObject] Utility macros for AMSC() with inheritance
entry.content:
When a struct/class with `ADVANCED_MEMORY_SAFETY_CHECKS()` is inherited,

a derived struct/class operator will use customized `operator new()` and

`operator delete()` too. If a class has multiple base classes with the

macro, a compiler may complain ambiguity between multiple `operator

new()`s. On the other hand, if a class uses private inheritance, a

compiler may report private `operator new()` that is making impossible

to `new` that class. This CL adds two utility macros to resolve these

issues:



- `INHERIT_MEMORY_SAFETY_CHECKS(BaseClass)`

Explicitly exports operators from given `BaseClass` to re-apply

checks specified in the parent class. This is the recommended option as

a derived class is likely to have the same characteristics to its baes

class.



- `DEFAULT_MEMORY_SAFETY_CHECKS()`

Re-define default `operator new()` and `operator delete()` using

global operators that comes with default checks.



Change-Id: I78eff5d8794cfd531bab6148c5745f29a60fc393

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5097995

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

entry.title: CRAS: renew deprecated histogram suffix Cras_DeviceType
entry.content:
In CL:5029458 we noticed that histogram suffixes are deprecated and

we should start using variants.



This CL removes the deprecated histogram suffix |Cras_DeviceType|, and

replaces it with |CrasFinalDeviceBreakdown|.



Note that there are two types of device breakdowns now, distinguished by

whether certain child types such as |BluetoothWideBandMic| should be

shown on its own, or if they should be aggregated onto their top-level

parent types.



This change also removes empty metrics of the form

|Cras.(DeviceRuntime|DeviceConfigureTime).(?!(Input|Output)).*|.



For example, |InternalMic| is an |Input| type, so it will only be

counted in |Cras.DeviceRuntime.Input.InternalMic.*|, and does not contribute to |Cras.DeviceRuntime.InternalMic.*|.



Bug: b/314710547

entry.title: [BreakIterator] Refactor by adding `Context`
entry.content:
This patch refactors `LazyLineBreakIterator`, in particular,

its hottest function `NextBreakablePosition` by introducing

the `Context` struct.



The `Context` struct caches 3 characters at the index, and is

responsible for advancing the current index. This refactoring

is a preparation for improving the performance of

`PreviousBreakOpportunity`.



Note, the current index isn't part of the struct, because

doing so seems to have a negative impact.



This patch has no behavior changes.



Bug: 1512434

Change-Id: I051eed75c2a666b8ef183154c0a7adebba7d3a85

entry.title: camera: Setup GPU channel for video capture utility service on ChromeOS
entry.content:
Build GPU channel by creating the viz::Gpu in the video capture utility

service, which is bind to viz::GpuClient of browser process. By this

way, video capture service can setup GPU channel to GPU process on

ChromeOS platform to create shared images.



Bug: b:314233378

entry.title: [IP Protection] Support OnBeforeTunnelRequest calls from HNT tests
entry.content:
This updates SpdySessionDependencies to hold a ProxyDelegate that

it will pass through to the CommonConnectJobParams. This ensures

that a test ProxyDelegate will have it's OnBeforeTunnelRequest

method called, allowing for testing interactions between the proxy

delegate OnBeforeTunnelRequest code and the net/ proxy job code

in HttpNetworkTransaction (HNT) unit tests.



As a test of this, update the IpProtectionProxyDelegate to set

an Authorization header in OnBeforeTunnelRequest, since this

functionality is relied upon by IP Protection.



This will also enable testing interactions such as the one

described here:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5116520/comment/6f4ad13f_61f037dc/



Bug: 1491092

Change-Id: I9ab8bcce70781ee0dbd36ad8f395c29f345d3adb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5119019

Reviewed-by: Matt Menke

Commit-Queue: Andrew Williams

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1238432}

entry.title: Fix the broken tests when AppStorage is enabled(Part 13).
entry.content:
When the kAppServiceStorage flag is enabled, AppService blocks the

app publishers creating until it's ready, after reading from the

AppStorage file. This affects some tests.



Modify the test code to wait for AppServiceProxy to be ready after

entry.title: [waffle]Remove the 'ENABLE_SEARCH_ENGINE_CHOICE' build flag
entry.content:
We remove the buildflag because it has caused a lot of issues when

we forget to check if the code compiles on Fuchsia for example.



Instead, we build the files on all Desktop operating systems and

make sure that the `SearchEngineChoiceService` is only initialized

on the operating systems in which we want to display the screen.

entry.title: Make edge carets for atomic inline blocks painted by their container
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/c/3620254, it became possible to have carets

before or after a non-editable inline-level element, if there was

nowhere else to place the caret without crossing into the non-editable

element. Before this, all carets inside an inline formatting context

would have been placed at a text offset, rather than at the edges of

an element.



When `CaretDisplayItemClient` computes the caret rectangle for a caret

position, it also computes the containing block that should paint it,

and it does that by using the caret's layout object if it's a

`LayoutBlock`, or its containing block if it isn't. For carets at the

edges of non-editable atomic inline blocks (e.g. inline-block,

inline-flex...), this gets the wrong result, since the layout object

is a `LayoutBlock`, but the caret should be painted by the inline

formatting context's containing block. In those cases, the caret ends

up not being painted.



The method in `CaretDisplayItemClient` that computes the painter block

doesn't know whether the caret is at the edge or inside an atomic

inline block, and so it can't know whether to use its containing

block. However, `LocalCaretRect` also contains a root box fragment,

whose layout object seems to match the computed painter block, except

that for carets at the edges of atomic inline blocks where it is the

inline formatting context's container.



This patch changes the code that computes the painter block to use

the root box fragment's layout object, if the root box fragment is

non-null, and uses the old algorithm to compute the painter block

otherwise. It also adds DCHECKs to make sure the behavior doesn't

change for cases other than atomic inline blocks, and to ensure that

the invariant of the painter block being either the caret's layout

block or its direct container keeps being held.



Bug: 1499405

Change-Id: Id552035b56a7bd51c4f90029801e9d3f52bb765f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5110302

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

Commit-Queue: Koji Ishii

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1238390}

entry.title: media/gpu/vaapiWrapper: Don't hold lock in encoding functions
entry.content:
vaMapBuffer() on encoded chunk is blocked until the encoding is

complete. It takes a few of hundreds milliseconds on old intel devices

because the encoding is performed using a sheder in GPU and thus is

impacted rendering workload. This likely happens on old chromebox (e.g.

puff) because it is connected to high resolution monitor like 2K.



The global vaapi lock is held while the encoder is blocked. Therefore,

it also blocks other vaapi works e.g. video decoders, MJPEG decoders,

and other video encoder in case of simulcast. The blocked vaapi works

are being accumulated and it also delays itself encoding the next

frame. It results a lot of pending frames in the encoder queue and a

user observes long delay in screen sharing.



This CL mitigates the issue by not holding the global vaapi lock if a

VA-API driver is a thread-safe in DownloadFromVABuffer() and

UploadVideoFrameToSurface(), GetEncodedChunkSize(), which are used

mainly by video encoders.



Bug: b:298660336

Test: screen sharing in Google Meet on puff

Change-Id: I0b809fc1a275cfc3451f9da7b722582b36fe963f
